page.title: 14COASTAL ECOLOGY, KIRKCALDY
page.content: Although the coastal area to the immediate south of Kirkcaldy is dominated by the surface workings of Seafield Colliery, there is a pleasant coastal walk south to Kinghorn. The coastline is predominantly rocky, with sandstones and conglomerates being the most common types to be found. Some of the deposits do contain fossils, especially those nearer Kinghorn. This coastal stretch is also well- known for its offshore birds. These include shags, gannets, terns, and eider ducks etc., as well as different varieties of wintering geese.
